sentence.Network_en: Toni looked at him rather haughtily.
Haughtily, he stalked out onto the second floor where I was standing.
sentence.Network_cn: 他傲然跨出电梯, 走到二楼,我刚好站在那儿.

To treat haughtily ., 傲慢无礼地对待.

entry.tran: 高傲自大的;倨傲无礼的;目中无人的
entry.def: You use haughty to describe someone's behaviour or appearance when you disapprove of the fact that they seem to be very proud and to think that they are better than other people.

example.ex: He spoke in a haughty tone.

auth_sentence.content: But the shark simply continued to stare, before slowly and somewhat haughtily, in my opinion turning around and gliding away.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the shark simply continued to stare, before slowly and somewhat haughtily, in my opinion turning around and gliding away.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the shark simply continued to stare, before slowly and somewhat haughtily, in my opinion turning around and gliding away.

auth_sentence.content: She once told me, a little haughtily, I never wore a pair of trousers in my life.
auth_sentence.res_content: She once told me, a little haughtily, I never wore a pair of trousers in my life.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She once told me, a little haughtily, I never wore a pair of trousers in my life.
